summary: Ice hockey is an exciting team sport played on ice. Two teams use sticks to hit a small rubber puck into the opponent's net. Each goal scores a point, and the team with the most points wins. The game originated in Canada and has specific rules and rink dimensions. It became an Olympic sport in 1920 and is now popular worldwide. Women's ice hockey gained more popularity when body checking was removed in the 1980s, and it joined the Olympics in 1998.
title: Ice hockey
